Hey guys...
I`m looking for two roommates starting in August. I`m open to 6-8month lease and even longer if both parties agree.
The home is less than seven years old..big 2300 sq ft..four bedroom..two1/2 bath...fruit trees..backyard...pets negotiable.. fireplace..two car garage...w/d...large kitchen...lots of storage...great quiet safe neighborhood...great for commuters...101..280...680...close to many shops...stores..bank..etc.
I`m asking 1200 for the larger room and 1000 for the smaller room....negotiable!!!
Utilities run around sixty dollars a month per person. Deposit will be last months rent. Couples are welcome! We like to create community around here.
We would prefer people who are non-student`s...outgoing..and open-minded..professionals...clean clean clean...considerate of shared space and sleeping hours of roommates...no rules here...we just ask that you are considerate and appropriate..
We are a couple of women but would not mind either gender.
This is a great house with plenty attributes...looking for good people to fill it`s walls.
Text if you have any questions...thanks!
Oh there is a hypoallergenic dog that will live here to...Abbey is her name! She`s a weimaraner...

postings.body:
I`ve been the sole signee on a month to month lease on a charming but ramshackled house on beacon hill for the past several years, living with friends and bandmates.
we were told recently that the house was to be put up for sale in july and we had to move. then i learned that the owners had changed their minds, and would wait until next year to put the house up, as it would require some costly improvements to sell.
my housemates have all found accommodations already and i have been left here alone to fill the house back up with peeps and keep it going at the last minute.
It`s a rare and special opportunity for the right person/people. great neighborhood. cheap rent. ideal for a poor musician. Theres a semi-sound proofed practice space in the basement. no credit check/deposit/last months rent/bullshit. hit me up, we`ll grab a beer and decide if it`d be a good fit.
cheers!!!
-danny

Are you looking for a friendly Maui experience? We offer a clean, quiet, pleasant, and comfortable atmosphere at an affordable rate. These two very attractively decorated rooms for one or two guests include a flat screen TV w/directv, free wifi, a ceiling fan, and a 3` in-room fridge to provide you with all the comforts of home. Which room you choose depends on your preferred sleeping arrangements! The "Front" (gold) room has a double bed. The "Woody" (ivory) room has a twin day bed with a twin trundle bed underneath, with easy space-saving accessibility. These two rooms share a bath. On-site parking next to your own shady lanai offers easy access to your own private entrance. You are welcome to make full use of our modern and well-equipped kitchen, and to help yourself to our daily continental breakfast (and all-day snack corner) of coffee & tea, home-baked treats (like banana bread, chocolate cherry cake, oatmeal raisin cookies..), fresh fruit, yogurts, oatmeal packs, and packaged snacks/popcorn. For your relaxation and entertaining we have a big, breezy second story gazebo-style deck with a gas BBQ grill and a wifi accessible shady lounging area. We now have a convenient new guest laundry area, too. We are located in central Kihei, in the very walkable Kalama Park/Foodland Town Center neighborhood. It is just a couple of short blocks to most of Maui`s best beaches, many restaurants and niteclubs, 24/hr grocery and shopping areas, the library, and the MauiBus line. Beach towels are provided, and coolers, beach chairs, snorkel gear, and boogie boards are available for your use. And, we charge NO cleaning fee! postings.body:
Hi! I am moving out of my current sublet August 8th and need someone to fill my room until Sept 1st. At that point the lease will become month to month and you`ll have the option to continue renting until at least the end of Dec.
Rent is $1305/month plus ~$80 for utilities.
The room is big, gets great natural light, and there are 2 bathrooms so you only share a bathroom with one other person. You would have 3 other roommates (all awesome girls in their mid-twenties), washer/dryer, backyard, garage for storage, and an incredible view of the Golden Gate Bridge from the kitchen window! You are 3 blocks away from Fisherman`s Wharf and Fort Mason and super close to all of the great bars/restaurants on Polk St. If you have a car there is plenty of street parking. I also currently have one of the parking spots in the garage which is available for an additional $150/month.
The small caveat is that my room is a converted living room with sliding doors that lead into the master so one roommate and her (adorable/quiet/hypoallergenic) dog will walk through occasionally. It has not been a privacy issue at all this year and definitely won`t be for such a small amount of time! As you can see in the pictures, the kitchen is big enough to fit two couches and serves as great communal space.
Please reply if you are interested and include a little bit about yourself. A link to your Facebook profile would be helpful and will speed up the process. I will get back to you as soon as possible and we can hopefully set up a time this week for you to view the room!

This one-of-a-kind rental is right in the heart of the nation`s oldest city.
St. Augustine`s rich history is all within walking distance. Park your car in our driveway and stroll downtown or ride one of our 3 bicycles.
Our beautifully restored one bedroom Carriage House apartment is located in St.Augustine`s historic Abbott Tract, just 4 blocks north of the Castillo de San Marcos, and is situated on the estate of a 19th Century Victorian Home. The rental includes access to our private dock on Water Street, with stunning views of St. Augustine`s Inlet and bay. We also have 2 kayaks for you to use.
The carriage house has accommodations for up to five people, with a large bedroom containing a king-sized bed and a single sleeper loveseat, and the living room has a queen-sized sleeper sofa.
The modern, fully-equipped kitchen includes all brand new appliances, cookware, glassware and utensils. Professional height counter tops make cooking a pleasure.
The apartment has wifi, brand new ductless air conditioning, two flat-screen televisions with satellite TV and a full bath, a private courtyard with deck and grill.
Includes off-street parking for one vehicle and laundry facilities.
Everything St. Augustine has to offer is right at your fingertips with this one-of-a-kind rental.
Take advantage of our introductory price of $150 per night (3 night minimum, per city ordinance). Weekly/monthly rates also available.
Any questions? Call Greg Jackson at
 show contact info
and please mention you saw this ad on the St. Augustine craigslist!

Review from Jill and Chuck G.

The listing photos were exactly as it looked when we arrived , the location was perfect , and the property was immaculate ! We had our 2 furry babies with us and it was perfect for them because the courtyard was completely enclosed . We were so close to town that we could walk , or ride the bikes that are provided for you including lock and helmets . The grounds across the street were perfect for walking the dogs .The area was completley safe to walk in during the evenings and the kayaks were great ( they also had life vests with them ) . The bed and pillows were comfy and the house was well equipped , including a gas grill. I give this property a 5 out of 5 . It was wonderful and we will most definently stay here again !!!"

Available from Aug 16th (For serious consideration, please specify your preferred move-in and move-out dates).
LOCATION
Peaceful and orderly neighborhood in Roxbury. Plenty of MBTA bus routes are 2 minutes away:14, 19, 23, 28, 45 and 44. Easy commute to Southend, Downtown and Longwood Medical Area. The house is not very far from the Dudley Station bus terminal where the frequent Silver Line (buses #4 and 5) start its route to South Station, Downtown Crossing and Financial District etc. Near the house are ; a Boston Police Department station, a supermarket, a small shopping mall, Walgreens, and a YMCA. This YMCA has a nice gym, sauna and a swimming pool. If you walk onto Blue Hill Ave, you will see a Super Stop & Shop, Bank of America, CVS and Dunkin` Donuts.The exact address will be disclosed to serious inquirers.
ROOM AND THE HOUSE
This room is on the 1st floor in a completely remodeled 3-family home. Room will be furnished with a bed, a desk, a chair, and some shelving space. A walk-in closet comes with this room. Almost everything in the house is new including the appliances and the heating system. No washer and drier in the house. We use two laundromats nearby.
WE ARE
two females (in our 20s) and a male (middle-aged) roommates. Friendly and considerate, highly professional in our respective fields: a graduate student, an editorial assistant and a professional writer who travels often. We are all new to this area and have different hours and schedules, doing our own things. Each and every one of us is very invested in our academic pursuits and we try to keep the atmosphere conducive to studying and resting. A couple of house-rules are in place : No loud music or TV in the apartment and we rarely have visitors, let alone overnight guests. We know these rules will be a major turn-off to many people, but we believe we can find a like-minded roommate who can have fun outside the house. Folks upstairs are affiliates at Harvard, BU, Northeastern and Boston Medical Center etc.
SEEKING
A roommate who is clean and quiet, non-smoking and without pets or overnight guest. First and last months` rent are required to hold the room (non-refundable), and a $300 security deposit (refundable) is additionally needed before moving in.
*Please make sure to specify your preferred move-in and move-out dates*

postings.heading: TOP LOCATION Upscale, Furnished, Updated, Rfdeck, Concierge, All utls

postings.body:
Whether this is your first visit or your 22nd visit to SF, we invite you to stay with us in San Francisco! The room has a ridiculously comfy Queen bed that you will just melt into after a full day of SFestivities. Must be a Labrador lover!
Our apartment is warm and homey. Unfortunately, this is hard to come by in SF. Hardwood floors throughout, with an amazing bathtub - feel free to use the Epsom salts! We have it available for most of August, and YOU CAN MOVE IN NOW!
Guests have access to the bathroom, kitchen, living room, and deck!
All three of us work full-time, so during the day we will most likely be out between the hours of 8-5, then we enjoy laid-back after-work hours where we might watch a movie and have a drink.
I love the Portola because it is usually sunnier than the rest of SF. There is a huge park nearby and plenty of great views.
There are a couple of good buses that go into the city. If you have a car, there is street parking.
We have an indoor Labrador that loves people! Sorry, no more pets. :(

postings.heading: SEEKING AWESOME COMPATIBLE ROOMMATES

postings.body:
Hello,
I am a single, career, minded professional young woman looking for similar. My home is 2 bedroom, one bath apt. less than a mile (east) from DT Bellevue. I work, attend social events a few evenings a week, and I am looking forward to my next trip to Europe.
My situation: I have household furnishings for all the common areas, and I understand this could be an impediment, or could be a great situation, depending on the person: The bedroom and some of the common hallway closet is yours, but otherwise, the place in fully furnished. Ideal for someone who just has bedroom furnishings, since I have all kitchen / living area necessities.
Truly looking for a communicative, straightforward individual who can articulate what he / she desires in a living situation and is open to communication in a positive (not hostile) way to resolve the issues that surface in a common living situation. (I am attempting to conclude a deeply passive- aggressive roommate situation, because this is not the energy I desire in my life.)
I have a deep desire for peace (and cleanliness) my my living environment, and sometimes live that out through having classical music play (at a very low volume) some of the time. I am true looking for harmony and shared interest in a roommate situation; not that we have to be best friends, But only share similar values in a common living situation. Ping me if interested,
Amanda
